name: Cities With Tree Names Quiz | USA - Cities | 10 Questions

questions.text: What city was secretly built during World War Two to help in the development of the world's first atomic weapons?
questions.explanation:
Oak Ridge, Tennessee.

	Oak Ridge is now Tennessee's 5th largest city and is known as 'Science City USA'.

questions.text: Cedar Rapids and Cedar Falls are both located on the Cedar River in what Midwestern State?
What Florida city made news during the 2000 Presidential election because of the 'Butterfly Ballot'?
This city in the Finger Lakes region is where Mark Twain met his wife, wrote many of his books and is buried. What city is it?
Oakland, California, is located across the bay from San Francisco. In which cardinal direction would you look to if you wanted to see Oakland from San Francisco?
This city hosts the 'King Cotton Bass Classic' fishing tournament and is known as the 'Bass Capital of the World'. What is it?
If you visited this town nestled in the White Mountains you could ski or tour Fort Apache Historic Park.
Due to its location near several national parks this town is known as the 'Gateway to the Parks'. What is it?
questions.explanation:
Cedar City, Utah.

	Cedar City is near to Bryce Canyon, Zion and the Grand Canyon National Parks.

questions.text: Thomas Edison's last and greatest laboratory was built here. It is the home of the Thomas Edison National Historic Site. What is it?
Some of this city's many famous citizens include Kirk Douglas, Gerald Ford, and Bob Hope who was appointed the 'Honorary Mayor'. What is this city?
